H0.text: new york heart association functional classification of angina. I

H1.text: new york heart association functional classification of angina. III

H2.text: new york heart association functional classification of angina. IV

H3.text: new york heart association functional classification of angina. II

A4.text: The New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Classification provides a simple way of classifying the extent of heart failure.

A5.text: Canadian Cardiovascular Society grading of angina pectoris is an alternative classification system for angina.

A6.text: Middle-age patients who experience moderate to severe angina (grading by classes II, III, and IV) have a five-year survival rate of approximately 92%.
